description: The HEAD operation retrieves metadata from an object without returning the object itself.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.technique: T1537 - Transfer Data to Cloud Account
unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: The HeadObject API call helps verify the existence of data in S3 buckets, allowing attackers to understand what data is available for transfer or collection.
Attackers may use HeadObject to discover information about objects in S3 buckets, which can help identify sensitive accounts or resources within a cloud environment.
This API call provides metadata about objects, helping attackers discover the organization and structure of files stored in S3, facilitating further actions.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.technique: T1530 - Data from Cloud Storage Object
unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: The operation assists in identifying which specific cloud storage objects might contain valuable data for exfiltration.
By accessing metadata, attackers can infer details about the cloud infrastructure, such as object creation dates, storage classes, and more, providing insights into the environment's configuration.

The ability to query metadata from S3 objects can help attackers gather information about the usage and configuration of cloud services, potentially revealing misconfigurations or security weaknesses.

incidents.description: Tales from the cloud trenches: Amazon ECS is the new EC2 for crypto mining

securityImplications: Attackers might use HeadObject to gather metadata about sensitive files stored in S3.
